alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 20 at 7:49PM MDT until October 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FRIDAY... .Gusty west winds will combine with renewed very dry conditions to result in critical fire weather Friday afternoon for the high valleys, foothills and far northern plains. The highest fire danger will be found in the northern foothills and adjacent lower elevations, where the strongest winds are expected. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MIDDLE PARK... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 6 PM MDT Friday. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 213 - Middle Park. * Timing...12 pm Friday through 6 pm Friday. * Winds...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts as high as 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...12 to 17%. * Impacts...Above normal temperatures, low relative humidity, and breezy conditions could lead to rapid fire spread for ready to burn fuels. Avoid any burning or outdoor activities that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet
